case_vignette: A 33-year-old woman comes to the physician for week-long episodes of headaches that have occurred every four weeks for the last year. During these episodes she also has bouts of lower abdominal pain and breast tenderness. She is often irritable at these times. Her menses occur at regular 28-day intervals with moderate flow. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks ago. She drinks two to five beers on social occasions and used to smoke a pack of cigarettes daily, but stopped 6 months ago. Her mother and sister have hypothyroidism. Physical examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having headaches and lower abdominal pain that keep coming back every four weeks for the last year, and during these times, my breasts also feel tender and I get quite irritable.
How old are you?
I am 33 years old.
Are you currently taking any medications?
Not that I'm aware of; I haven't mentioned any medications.
Have you had any changes in your menstrual cycle?
No, my menstrual cycles occur regularly every 28 days.
Do you have a family history of reproductive health issues?
My mother and sister have hypothyroidism, but I didn't mention any specific reproductive health issues.
Have you noticed any abnormal hair growth or acne on your body?
No, I haven't mentioned experiencing abnormal hair growth or acne.
**Final Diagnosis:** Premenstrual Syndrome (PMS)
